name: Radisson Blu Resort & Spa at Dubrovnik Sun Gardens

reviews.text: We fell in love with this coastline. The landscape/changes in the light/ the crystal clear sea/family run restaurants all around are like Greece 20 years ago. Hard to generalise about all Croatians but have to say that we have left with a very positive view of this country based on attentive service, kindness and the very good level of English spoken which allowed for more humour/ understanding etc ............
reviews.title: Very Cool Place with Wow Factor. Quiet in June but mad busy/noisier in July/Aug.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is shiny new and ultra clean. Using top quality natural materials: white stone / solid wood floors with stainless steel /large glass panels to allow maximum exposure to the the turquoise sea, they have created a very modern posh resort. Fabulous interior design/ awesome chairs all over the place. It feels very special. The spa is gorgeous, basic treatments are same price as UK, bar drinks a bit pricey but like most 5 star hotels the food/drinks are over priced. I think about £4 for a glass of wine and less for a beer. Fruit smoothies, which the children loved, at pools are £5 each and are not natural - made from syrups.
reviews.title: Nice but Expensive:

reviews.text: We decided to book hotel /flights independently rather than package as we are getting very middle aged and grumpy ! Self catering residences are wonderful ( honestly ) and have a fridge, a basic hob and microwave (but no oven) and are in the grounds of the hotel to allow more flexibility for families. You can drink the water here so if you are happy with it, having a fridge is a big plus. There is a supermarket on site and if you have a car a bigger supermarket with is about a 5 minute drive away. Having a hire car for the week was ideal for us with two older children for getting food, sight- seeing. For older children there are a few watersports clubs scattered
reviews.title: An absolute pleasure

reviews.text: around the coast.
reviews.title: One of the best places I have stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a 40 minute drive with stunning views from the airport and 20 minutes drive from beautiful Dubrovnic. Top tennis - 3 clay courts. You can book the tennis coach in advance or just the court for a hit. Great gym - beware no weights less than 4kgs for ladies like me out there !
reviews.title: Best choice in Dubrovnik

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled to the Radisson Dubrovnik for the last week of September as part of a small tour group. We chose the hotel due to a combination of a good rate and the hotel website which promised high quality facilities.
reviews.title: Good Quality Hotel but needs some improvements

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facilities were generally as promised. The hotel is newly opened and everything had a brand new feel about it. As mentioned by others, a more comprehensive hotel brochure and map of the facilities would have been helpful as well as information on what was and wasn't open. The hotel operates to winter and summer schedules which is understandable but walking through a darkened complex at night with so few guests and apartments empty gave the place an abandoned feeling. This wasnt helped by the limited numbers in the main bar.
reviews.title: Would I go back? in a heartbeat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the reviews we were prepared to find a hotel still struggling with service issues however our experience was generally good. Possibly due to the time of year the hotel was not at its busiest and therefore we never encountered the problems mentioned in previous reviews with the exception of the final bill which included a mini bar tab which we hadn't run up. However this was removed without quibble. In addition the restaurant several times did not have our choice of wine offering us in every case a much more expensive alternative.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel but some facilities not available

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were generally friendly and efficient and all requests were acted upon quickly. The standard of food for breakfast and dinner (we were there on a half board option) was very good and the hotel made an effort to vary the cuisine from day to day
reviews.title: Great Hotel but some areas could be improved.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were pretty much what you would expect for a hotel of this standard although the tea/coffee/milk should have been renewed each day which we found wasnt done regularly.
reviews.title: Location unparalleled

reviews.text: My husband and I recently traveled to Dubrovnik to meet my mother and two of my sisters and to celebrate my mother's 80th birthday. The setting for the Radisson is absolutely gorgeous, though it is quite far from the old town of Dubrovnik, necessitating travel by bus, ferry, or in our case, rental car. The 2 bedroom apartment was nicely equipped and allowed us to cook dinner in the apartment each evening. The main problem, especially when we first arrived, was the very poor service. It seems that the staff's favorite phrase was "Not possible" (even for requests that would be easily accommodated at any basic motel). Examples include requests for ice, clean towels, a coffee maker for the room. Many requests were later answered, and some of the staff were quite nice, but the overall service left us deeply unimpressed.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting, lousy service

reviews.text: We are in the middle of a weeklong stay at the apartments at this hotel.. Apparently, the staff missed the corporate video on the "Yes We Can!" customer service model. The phrase we hear most is "No, Not Possible". Can we have a coffee maker in our apartment (the hotel was almost empty, there were probably about 300 available)? No, not possible. Can we have some soap for the dishwasher? No, not possible. We didn't get maid service the first day. The second day, the maid came and decamped with all of our towels, even the ones we left hanging as per the instructions to indicate that we would use them again. It took two calls to the front desk to get some more. We have to ask every night at the front desk for them to turn on the area lights around the building, so that we don't accidently fall down the darkened stairwell. During our stay, maintenance wanted to install room safes and an evacuation plan. When my sister and her husband tried to check in, they told her that "No, not possible" since our two bedroom suite with a sofa-bed only accomodated two people (3 of which had already checked in). She was finally allowed to go to the room, after leaving her passport and told to come back in 30 minutes so that she could be reported to the police (direct quote still don't know what that means.) I can go on but hope this is enough for some Radisson Blu executive out there to make an emergency phone call to Croatia. I am not trying to be mean or petty here - the facilities are new and beautiful and I would love to return to a place that is not marred by such poor service. I hope to read glowing reviews about the service turn around in a few months time.
reviews.title: Help! Send towels and toilet paper!

reviews.text: Do not visit this horrendous place. The whole thing has a deeply impacted on the nearby village. There is also a major road immediately behind from which there is a constant roar of traffic - not to mention the constant noise from the aircon.
reviews.title: Concrete monstrosity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our honeymoon on this hotel and had the most fantastic time.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC
A spectacular new resort serving the Dubrovnik area!
reviews.text: Friendly and professional staff, great room with a huge balcony and a stunning view, nice spa, good location with transfer all day to Dubrovnik, super service everywhere on the area (restaurants, pools, bars, spa etc.).

A poor experience and not a credit to the Radisson name. Location and access to Dubrovnik a real problem, plus issues over seaviews, poor food (poor vegetables, and hopeless for vegetarians, gluten-free and other special diets), and practical room facilities.
reviews.title: Big problems with access to Dubrovnik, seaviews, food and practical room facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start with the few positives. The staff are very pleasant – but so are nearly all Croatians, so that doesn’t distinguish the hotel. The rooms are large, clean and modern, but have lots of practical problems – see below. But there are some real problems which we didn’t believe were ‘teething problems.’
reviews.title: BEWARE OF THE WINE AT THE RADISSON BLU RESORT DUBROVNIK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seaview – we booked ‘deluxe’ rooms as our agent said standard rooms have partial seaview and deluxe have full seaview. These deluxe rooms had view overlooking apartments and the apartments’ carpark with just a glimpse of sea from the corner of the balcony. We complained, and so did our rep, but weren’t moved.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and grounds

reviews.text: Location – it’s a VERY long way out. We’d been told there were regular boat and minibus transfers – there weren’t. The boat service was cancelled throughout as it was ‘too cold’ in the first week of October, and the minibus was reduced to a couple of very awkwardly-timed (and not cheap) trips a day. We were told this was because most of the guests at that time happened to be conferences without a need for the bus – but you can’t check up who else is staying before you pick the time of your stay! Taxis are no alternative as we were told they would be £35 - £40 each way. Also bear in mind that if you book daytrips with your tour firm, you’ll have to be picked up around 40 minutes earlier than other hotels and arrive home 40 minutes later, which makes a big difference on very long trips like the popular Montenegro trip.
reviews.title: A perfect holiday in a wonderful hotel

reviews.text: Food is a problem unless you want to eat nothing but red meat, and tiny very creamy desserts. Very few vegetables. Fish options limited and not always well cooked (eg tough monkfish). Forget it if you are vegetarian. I am gluten-free and was told on day 1 the only thing they could provide without a gluten-y sauce was octopus! As the staff are nice, they eventually offered plain chicken instead but this took over 30 minutes to arrive with dry, undercooked rice.
reviews.title: Superb!

aka: Radisson Blu Resort And Spa At Dubrovnik Sun Gardens
description: Enjoying a privileged location just steps away from a picturesque beach, resort offers wide array of rooms, suites and residences. With its award winning 3500 m2 Spa, large Sport center, beach, 3 outdoor pools and marina, conference facilities it's designed for ultimate luxury holiday experience. Gourmet heaven is the only way to describe the dining options at this five-star Adriatic Sea hotel. Guests are spoilt for choice with a fabulous array of restaurants, poolside eateries, bars and a unique Market Place concept, serving up delicious international and local dishes.
